intro: Pedicularis bella var. crestifrons, commonly known as the Crested Lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic growth habit and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of pink and purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a whorled pattern along the stem. This species thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats.
